claim: Darth Vader says to Luke in The Empire Strikes Back, Obi-Wan never told you what happened to your father.

supporting.text: Darth Vader's statement is accurate because Obi-Wan Kenobi did not reveal to Luke Skywalker that Darth Vader was his father.

attacks.text: Darth Vader's statement is accurate because Obi-Wan Kenobi did not reveal to Luke Skywalker that Darth Vader was his father.

Obi-Wan Kenobi did indirectly inform Luke about his father by stating 'Darth Vader betrayed and murdered your father,' which could be interpreted as a partial truth or metaphor for Anakin Skywalker's fall to the dark side.
Obi-Wan's phrasing was intentionally misleading, as he knew Anakin became Darth Vader but chose to present it as a literal death to simplify Luke's understanding and emotional burden.
Luke had no prior knowledge of Darth Vader being his father, so from his perspective, Obi-Wan never explicitly revealed this fact, making Vader's statement technically true.

supporting.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi deliberately withheld the truth about Anakin Skywalker's transformation into Darth Vader from Luke.

attacks.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi deliberately withheld the truth about Anakin Skywalker's transformation into Darth Vader from Luke.
Obi-Wan may have withheld the truth to protect Luke from emotional trauma until he was ready to handle it.
Luke needed to know the truth earlier to make informed decisions about his training and allegiances.
Obi-Wan's statement 'from a certain point of view' suggests he believed he was not lying but reframing the truth.
This reframing still constitutes deception, as it obscures critical facts about Luke's lineage.

supporting.text: The dialogue reflects a pivotal moment in the narrative where Luke learns a significant truth about his lineage.

attacks.text: The dialogue reflects a pivotal moment in the narrative where Luke learns a significant truth about his lineage.
The dialogue is misleading because Obi-Wan did tell Luke about his father, albeit in a different context and with partial truths.
Obi-Wan's earlier statements were intentionally vague to protect Luke from the full truth until he was ready.
Vader's statement is technically accurate because Obi-Wan never explicitly stated that Vader was Luke's father.

supporting.text: Darth Vader's revelation contradicts Obi-Wan Kenobi's earlier assertion that Darth Vader had betrayed and murdered Luke's father.

attacks.text: Darth Vader's revelation contradicts Obi-Wan Kenobi's earlier assertion that Darth Vader had betrayed and murdered Luke's father.
Obi-Wan Kenobi may have lied to protect Luke from the painful truth about his father's identity.
Obi-Wan could have believed his statement was true, as Anakin Skywalker effectively 'died' when he became Darth Vader.
Darth Vader might be lying to manipulate Luke into joining the Dark Side.
Vader has no reason to lie, as he genuinely wants Luke to know the truth and join him.
